title: Content Marketing 101: 3 Tips to Combat Content Blindness
text:
Content Marketing 101: 3 Tips to Combat Content Blindness September 17, 2015 -- 
NEW YORK , Sept. 17, 2015 /PRNewswire/ --With small business brands continually focusing their attention on producing quality content attractive to their target audiences, the stark reality is there isn't enough time in the day to consume a fraction of the content that is created. This begs the question, "Does content blindness exist and if so, how can you combat it?" PR Newswire's Small Business PR Toolkit contributing author Heather Wied answers this question with a resounding "yes," and in her latest post, provides three ways that small businesses can cut through content clutter. Get back to basics. Wied provides the five steps to the consumer purchase process and highlights which step content marketing falls under. By understanding the basics of the sales cycle and striking when the iron is hot, Wied suggests your content should provide value in time, money or quality. Embrace your brand's voice. What better way to keep your reader's attention than by telling stories that grab at their emotions? Your brand's story is your own and that affords a natural tie in for emotional connections because stories are familiar. Content amplification. Wied sites an example of a customer that launched a new platform and chose to promote the launch through their owned channels and limited the amplification to a blog post. Wied knows that isn't enough and she suggests you should maximum your distribution and choose your outlets based on your target market and strengths. 
To read further on the three ways to combat content blindness in your content marketing strategy, read Wied's entire article here: http://bit.ly/1W4WIYk .
